CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 23, 1960, pg. A13, reads: "Century Club Fetes Wives - members of the Century Club and their wives enjoyed a delicious steak dinner party at the Greene Hearthe last Saturday evening, after keeping a date with "Porgy and Bess" at the Nixon Theatre. Attty. [sic] George Shields had charge of the brief program, which included a salutation to Mr. and Mrs. Elbert Kennedy, who were celebrating their 17th wedding anniversary.  Pronty L. Ford, social chairman, seated head of the table, right foreground, presented the club's gift to the happy pair, a large crystal punch bowl. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of Century Club members and their wives, including Pronty L. Ford, seated head of the table in right foreground, gathered around banquet tables in the Greene Hearth
